result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony L. Carothers

records.addlTxt:
8:32 AM Cases called: 20CF1391, 21CF193 & 22CF945. Defendant Tony L. Carothers in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Tony L. Carothers. Attorney Robert Thorson appeared in court for Tony Carothers. Attorney Tiffany Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. There is an agreement.

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 2 in 20CF1391: Fraud against Financial Institution without the Repeater. 
Defendant enters a no contest plea to an amended Count 1: Substantial Battery and Count 2: Felony Bail Jumping without the repeater. 

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts the pleas and finds the defendant guilty. 22CF945 is ordered dismissed and read in with all other counts. 

Court orders:
3 years Probation sentence withheld with conditions on each count concurrent. 
No contact with M.L. or J.J.
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Probation can be transferred to another state if permitted by the receiving state.
court costs and surcharges

No jail credit. Jury trial can be removed from calendar.
Status conference on November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:54 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tony L. Carothers in court with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson. Defense confirms a copy of the Information was received and that it mirrors the complaint. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts the pleas.

Case is to be heard along with 20CF1391 and 21CF193 on 11/2/2022 at 8:30 AM in Branch 1.

2:00 PM Defendant Tony L. Carothers in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Tony L. Carothers.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin.  This is the time and date set for a Preliminary Hearing. 

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 

Court binds the matter over to Br. 1 for scheduling an arraignment.
Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

(Case called at 11:18 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Tony Carothers appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler. ADA Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. Victim A.P. makes a statement. 
Preliminary Hearing: 08/30/2022 at 2:00 PM.

Conditions:
No acts/threats of violence toward anyone.
